uk.ac.ed.methodius
Class ContentPotential

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.methodius.ContentPotential

public class ContentPotential
extends java.lang.Object

Graph made up of Entities and Facts representing limited Content Potential. Centred around a root (focal) object and radiating out depth entities. ContentPotential also contains within it methods to return a requested number of facts and so logically contains within it the Content Selection algorithm.

Method Detail

getRoot

public Entity getRoot()

getNFacts

public java.util.List getNFacts(int wanted)
return a limited number of facts. We have a List of CPFact objects in order of significance. Each CPFact can have a list of dependents, these dependents can have dependents and so on. We gather each level of CPFacts together, assigning them a working or effective significance which is made up of their basic significance and the significance of all the facts linking them to the focal object. The significance of a given fact = it's basic significance + twice it's parental significance. We stop when we run out of facts or have found enough.

Parameters:
the - number wanted
Returns:
list of Facts
